question: So how'd you like our little Carry-on over at that rancho? Kinda hit the spot didn't it?
answer: Hey, somebody get that stick on His knees.

question: Gracias.
answer: They call me Old Man Clanton. I'm What you might call the founder Of the feast. Now maybe you ain't Heard, but we skylark through Your dingy little country just About any time we damn well Please and big-hat, crummy- Lookin' free-holes stumblin' Around in the dark ain't allowed. Messican po-lice, huh? Think You're bad medicine, don't you? Hell, I've let stronger stuff run Down my leg. So next time we come Better step aside. Get in our Hair again, we'll saw your prods Off with butter knives and stuff 'em in your gobs. Ain't kiddin' neither. You been told. Now git.

question: Hold up, jefe. Got a joke I wanna Tell you.
answer: He say he know you killing him.

question: Now how'd he figure that out?
answer: He say he is no' afraid, someone Will revenge for him. A sick Horse.

question: A sick horse? What the hell...
answer: Something, I don't know, he talk Fancy, you know, like a priest. Is like, "a sick horse who sits---"

question: "Dear Governor Gosper-in re yours directing action against Cowboys, stop. Beg to inform have Twice sent deputies to serve Warrants on Cowboy suspects, Stop. Nothing to show for it but 2 dead deputies, stop. Short of deputizing U.S. Army am at loss- Wyatt Earp? Oh, right, Dodge City. Mr. Earp? My name's Dake, Crawley Dake. I'm the U.S. Marshal for-
answer: Forget it.

question: Excuse me?
answer: I said forget it, answer's no, I Don't want the job and that's Final. I'm going to Tombstone and Nothin' short of dyin's gonn Stop me. Good day.

question: But wait, you don't understand-
answer: No Marshal, you don't understand. I'm through with lawing, I'm Through with the whole Proposition. Forever. I did my Duty, now I'd like to get on with My life. That is if you don't Mind. Jesus. Good day now.

question: I see, off to strike it rich, Huh. All right, fine, wish you Luck. Tell you this though, never Was a rich man yet didn't wind up With a guilty conscience.
answer: Already got a guilty conscience, Might as well have the money too.

question: We're gonna do it, boys. Gonna Get ours. Feel it in my bones. All we have to do is keep our Eyes on that brass ring.
answer: Boy, look at all those stars. Bet You can see every star there is. Practical touch 'em. Kinda makes You think, you know? I mean you Look up and you think God made All that but he still remembered To make a little speck like me. Kinda flattering really. Hey, Wyatt, you believe in God? No, Come on, really, do you?

question: Maybe, yeah. Hell, I don't know.
answer: Well what do you think happens When you die?

question: Got me. Somethin'. Nothin'. I Don't know.
answer: I read this book, book on Spiritualism...

question: Bless you, darling Darling! Are you mad? You're not Wearing a bustle. How lewd!
answer: Oh, for Christ's sake!

question: Ed Bailey, you look like you're Just ready to burst. Well call me A fool but I guess I'll just have To call. Cover your ears, darling.
answer: God damn son of a...

question: Isn't that a daisy?
answer: Just pick up your money and go. Sick of listening to you simper.

question: Now Ed, are we cross?
answer: Skinny lunger, your guns don't Impress me. Wasn't for those guns You'd be nothin'.

question: Newcomers, eh? Names John Behan, I'm Cochise County Sheriff. Just Hit town?
answer: Just this minute. I'm Wyatt Earp, These're my brothers-

question: Wyatt Earp...Dodge City, right?
answer: Gave all that up. Going into business.

question: Well I'm the man to see. Besides Sheriff I'm also tax collector, Captain of the Fire Brigade, and Chairman of the Non-partisan Anti- Chinese league. A man of many Parts. Got a place to stay yet? I Also sit on the Townlot Commission. Got a couple of Lovely cottages coming up for Rent. Here, let me show you... The one next door and the one Across the street are vacant too. Same rent and I'll throw in a Good cleaning. Believe me, you Won't find a better deal within Town limits.
answer: Guess we'll take all three. ...and easy on the grain, I don't want 'em too fidgety.

question: What can I get you?
answer: Let me have one of those cigars. Kinda nice in here. You run it?

question: Milt Joyce, owner-operator.
answer: Well, excuse me for askin', Milt, But isn't it kinda dead in here?

question: You see that bird at the faro Table? That's Johnny Tyler. He Barged in here one day, said he Was takin' over the game, started Slappin' customer, wavin' his Gun around, scarin' off all the High-class play. Only trade comes In here now's just bummers and Drovers, just the dregs.
answer: Why don't you get rid of him and Get yourself straight dealer?

question: You back that Queen again, you Son of a bitch, I'll blow you Right out of that chair! Somethin' on your mind?
answer: Just wanted to let you know You're sitting in my chair.

question: That a fact?
answer: Yeah. It's a fact.

question: For a man that don't go heeled You run your mouth kinda reckless.
answer: Don't need to go heeled to get The bulge on a dub like you.

question: That a fact?
answer: Yeah. It's a fact.

question: Well I'm real scared.
answer: Damn right you're scared. I can See it in your eyes. Go ahead. Skin it. Skin that Smoke wagon and see what happens.

question: Listen Mister, I'm getting' tired-
answer: I'm getting tired of your gas. Jerk that pistol and go to work. I said throw down, boy. You gonna do something or just Stand there and bleed? No, I didn't think so. Here, Milt. Keepsake, hang it over the Bar. All right, youngster. Out You go... And don't come back. Ever. See how easy that was? Well we're off and running. Just Acquired us a quarter-interest in The game at the Oriental.

question: Since when is faro a business?
answer: Didn't you always say gambling's An honest trade?

question: I said poker's an honest trade. Only suckers buck the tiger. The Odds are all with the house.
answer: Depends how you look at it. I Mean it's not like anybody's Holding a gun to their heads.

question: Better go with 'em, honey. Here's Where I leave you.
answer: No, stay. Please stay with me.

question: Honey, I gotta start makin' money.
answer: Oh, all right.

question: Well I guess I don't have to go Right now. I guess I could stay a little while.
answer: No, no, I don't want to keep you.

question: No really, I can stay a while.
answer: Just go. It's all right. Wyatt, Really. Work well.

question: All right, I'm on fire! Black Seven, seven stickin' spades. Let's go!
answer: I'm your man... You win again. Well played, sir. You are on fire.

question: Told you. I'm red hot, I'm Blazin'! Now, red seven. Seven Stinkin' diamonds. Look out! Five Thousand! Let's go!
answer: Awful lot of money.

question: Can't take the heat, get outta The kitchen.
answer: You're the doctor. sad news, friend.

question: Just his style, Morg. Doesn't Mean anything.
answer: So tell me, Wyatt. I'm curious. Do you actually consider youself A married man? Forsaking all Others?

question: Well yeah. Pretty much. I mean I Was no angel when we met but People change Doc. I mean sooner Or later you gotta grow up.
answer: I see. And what would you do if "she" walked in her right now?

question: "She"?
answer: You know damn well who I mean. That dusky-hued lady Satan.

question: I don't know. Probably ignore her.
answer: Ignore her?

question: I'd ignore her. People can Change, Doc.
answer: I'll remember you said that.

question: Oh, hell... Satisfied?
answer: I stand corrected. Wyatt. You're An oak.

question: And you must be Doc Holliday.
answer: That's the rumor.

question: You retired, too?
answer: Not me. I'm in my prime.

question: Yeah, you look it.
answer: And you must be Ringo. Look, Darling, Johnny Ringo. The Deadliest pistoleer since Wild Bill, they say. What do you Think, darling? Should I hate him?

question: In vino veritas.
answer: Age quod agis.

question: Credat Judaeus Apella.
answer: Ecentus stultorum magister.

question: The man dealing faro. Who is he?
answer: That's Wyatt Earp. Made quite a Name for himself as a peace Officer in Kansas.

question: A peace officer... Impressive man
answer: Yes, very. And very married.

question: Enough? Never.
answer: Hey, is that "Old Dog Tray"? Sounds like "Old Dog Tray".

question: What?
answer: You know, Stephen Foster. "Oh, Susanna". "Camptown Races", Stephen-stinkin'-Foster!

question: I see, well this happens to be a Nocturne.
answer: A which?

question: I'm busy. We're all busy. Sorry, Mayor, but you're really barkin' Up the wrong tree.
answer: You tell 'em, Virge. You know, I was thinkin', maybe We ought to open our own place. That's the real money. Build it Up, milk it for all it's worth, Then sell it off for a bundle and Breeze out of this burg with more Money than Croesus and ready to Live like kings. Let's you and me Take a walk around town, Virge, See if we can scout us out a Couple of nice lots.

question: I can't hardly believe it. It's Working out just like you said, Wyatt. We're lootin' this burg Six ways through Sunday.
answer: Pretty fun too, isn't it?

question: Kinda, actually, yeah. I gotta admit. What're you up to today, son?
answer: Cat got your tongue? Wait a minute, Virgil! Where you goin'?

question: I couldn't help it, Wyatt. I Looked at that woman and it was Just like somebody slapping me in The face. I mean these people're Afraid to even walk down the Street and I'm trying to make Money off it like some kind of God damn vulture. That's not me, That's somebody I don't even know.
answer: Virgil, please. Don't do this to me.

question: It's got nothin' to do with you, Wyatt. It's-
answer: Nothing to do with me? I'm your Brother for Christ's sake. God, I Don't believe this. Talk to him, will you? Or hit him. Oh no, don't tell me...

question: Nothing to do with me? I'm your Brother for Christ's sake. God, I Don't believe this. Talk to him, will you? Or hit him. Oh no, don't tell me...
answer: Like you said, Wyatt. We're Brothers. Gotta back your Brother's play. Just did like I Figured you would.

question: Listen to me, both of you. This Is no good. This is trouble we Don't need. For the first time in Our lives we got a chance to stop Wandering and finally be a Family. Do this and you throw it All away. You saw what happened To Fred White.
answer: Come on, we're not about pickin' Fights. Just gonna keep a little Order, that's all.

question: Yeah?
answer: Like you said, just gotta know How to handle 'em. Old Fred Wasn't up to it. We know that We're doin', Wyatt.

question: All right, say you're right, say You don't get yourself killed. There's something else. It's too late for Virge, he Already rolled his bone. But it's Not too late for you, Morg.
answer: What're you talkin' about?

question: Run for your lives, boys! It's That great two-gun dog-catcher From Kansas!
answer: McMasters, isn't it? Listen, you Seen a black stallion with-

question: Look, I got a rule. I don't talk To lawmen. Dog-catchers neither.
answer: I'm not a lawman, I'm just a Private citizen getting' my Property back

question: Well in that case, I saw your Horse. Billy Clanton was takin' Him up to the Cut to show him Off. The boys're all up there Right now, branding. And in a Mood. Still want your property Back, Mr. Private Citizen?
answer: So what about you Cowboys anyway?

question: If I had to explain it you Wouldn't understand. Just say We're brothers to the bone.
answer: Yeah, but some of the things they Say your brothers've done...

question: Where'd you get that horse?
answer: Beauty, ain't he?

question: I asked where you got him.
answer: Where do you think? I stole him.

question: Look, I don't want any trouble With you but that's my horse and I mean to have him back. One way Or another.
answer: Come and get him.

question: Shut up. Give him his horse, Billy. Feel bad about ol' Fred. Just Can't hold back when I'm feelin' Woolly. Still, feel kinda bad. But now we're square. Anyway no Use for holdin' a grudge. I Deserved a rap in the head.
answer: Make you a deal. My brother took Over the Marshal's office in Tombstone. Got it in his head He's gonna make the place safe For widows and orphans. You and Your boys stay out of his way, I'll make sure he stays out of yours.

question: Fair enough. You know I got to Admit, you got a lot of bark on You comin' up here like this.
answer: They were all gonna jump me back There. What ever happened to one Against one?

question: Ain't our way. We go all on one, One on all. Fight one of us, you Fight us all. That's the Cowboy way.
answer: And how come you call yourselves Cowboys? Cowhands ride for the brand.

question: Oh, we ride for a brand all right. This brand. How 'bout you?
answer: This brand.

question: Nothin' to it.
answer: Maybe I jumped the gun. Maybe Those Cowboys aren't near as bad As they're painted. You know I Was thinkin', there's a lot of Money in the cattle business...

question: Wait a minute, you thinkin' of Getting in bed with the Cowboys?
answer: Business is business. Don't have To love 'em to work with 'em. Not If there's money in it.

question: Oh, hell...
answer: Well, hello.

question: We've never actually met. My Name's-
answer: Wyatt Earp, I know. I was Beginning to think we'd never Meet. This is fortuitous. That Means lucky.

question: I know what it means.
answer: What is it?

question: Easy now... That mare's in season.
answer: Oh... Now she's starting. How do they know?

question: They know. It's the scent. We Better split 'em up.
answer: I have a better idea, let's run It out of them!

question: Yeah, I'm an oak all right. You're not that crazy, are you?
answer: That was lovely!

question: You know you almost got us both Killed back there?
answer: Fun though, wasn't it?

question: You'd die for fun?
answer: Wouldn't you? You're laughing! I Was sure you never laughed.

question: I laugh sometimes
answer: Yes, but how often? Tell me, are You happy?

question: Am I happy? I don't know. Happy As the next man, I guess. I don't Laugh all day long like an idiot, If that's what you mean.
answer: You're a little touchy about it.

question: I'm not touchy, I just, it's a Silly question, that's all. Am I Happy? Are you happy?
answer: Of course, I'm always happy. Unless I'm bored. That blonde Woman, is that your wife?

question: What about her?
answer: Nothing... Tell me, what do you Want out of life?

question: Where do you get these questions?
answer: Just answer.

question: I don't know, make some money, Have some kids, you know.
answer: Doesn't suit you.

question: How would you know?
answer: Just doesn't, that's all.

question: Well I ought to know my own mind And I'm tellin' you what suits me Is a family and kids. That suits Me right down to the ground. In Fact, that's my idea of heaven. All right, what's your idea of heaven?
answer: Room service. See? You're laughing again. But That's what I want. Go places and Move and never look back and just Have fun. Forever. That's my idea Of heaven. Need someone to share It with, though.

question: You mean Behan? Then why are you with him?
answer: Well he's handsome and he's Charming. He's all right. For Now. Don't say it, I know, I'm Rotten. I can't help it. I've Tried to be good but it's too Boring.

question: The way you talk. Never heard a Woman talk like that.
answer: Oh look, I haven't got time to be Proper, I want to live. I'm a woman, I like men. If that's Unladylike then I guess I'm not a Lady. At least I'm honest.

question: Well you're different, no arguing That. But you're a lady all right. I'll take my oath on it.
answer: What's wrong?

question: I don't know, doesn't make any Sense. I almost can't look at You. Like it hurts.
answer: I know, me too. What should we do About it?

question: God...
answer: You know this is adultery. You Burn in hell for that.

question: Then let's make sure we get our Money's worth
answer: I must say this certainly has Been an unexpected little Windfall.

question: Fortuitous even.
answer: And I don't even know your full name.

question: Easy to fix. Wyatt Berry Stapp Earp.
answer: And I'm Josephine Sarah Marcus. My friends call me Josie.

question: Josie... No, I'm gonna call you Sadie.
answer: I hate Sadie.

question: Well you'll always be Sadie to me.
answer: Always?

question: Getting late. We better get back.
answer: So I assume we're regarding this As just a kind of interlude.

question: Look, it's too much of a tangle. I already cast my lot. I can't go Back and I can't sneak, feel back Enough as it is.
answer: You feel bad about this? About me?

question: I didn't mean it that way.
answer: You know you don't have to sneak. You could stay with me. I know Things, Wyatt. Sweet things. I Could make you so happy.

question: I can't, I'm sorry. Forgive me.
answer: ...all of me. Because I'm wonderful.

question: That the bottle Lou gave you? Better go easy on that stuff.
answer: I know what I'm doing. Where have You been?

question: Out ridin'. So... how you doin'?
answer: I don't know. I'm all right.

question: Really? You sure?
answer: Sure I'm sure. What is this?

question: Well, I was thinking, we've Already made a pile of money. Maybe we should just pull up Stakes and move on. And we could Stay on the move, you know? Just Keep going, see the world. Live On room service the rest of our Lives. How'd that be?
answer: Wyatt, what're you talkin' about?

question: I know. And nobody can make him.
answer: Wyatt! Just in time. Pull up a chair.

question: Been hittin' it awful hard, Doc.
answer: Nonsense, I have not yet begun to Defile myself.

question: But Doc-
answer: I won't be pawed at, thank you Very much

question: I'll wring your scrawny neck for you!
answer: That's enough, Clanton.

question: You takin' his part? I'm the one Was cheated. God damn pimps, You're all in it together.
answer: Nobody's in anything, Clanton, You're drunk. Go home and sleep It off.

question: Get your God damn hands off me! Don't you ever put your hands on One of us! Don't you ever try to Man-handle a Cowboy! We'll out Your God damn pimp's heart out! Understand, pimp?
answer: Don't you threaten me, you Little-

question: Your condition is quite advanced. I'd say you've lost some 60 percent Of your lung tissue. Maybe more.
answer: So what does that mean?

question: Two years, two days, hard to say. If you have any chance, it's to Stop now-smoking, drinking, Gambling, night-life. You must Have a healthy diet and most Importantly, you must have Complete rest-meaning you must Attempt to deny your marital impulse.
answer: Well, that sounds inviting.

question: How you feeling, Doc?
answer: Better.

question: That's good. I knew it wasn't nothin'.
answer: We must talk, darling. It appears We have to... redefine the nature Of our association.

question: What's that mean, Doc? You know I Don't understand when you talk up High like that. You mean you Don't want to be my lovin' man no more?
answer: Not exactly...

question: I'm a good woman to you, Doc. Don't I always take care of you? Nobody cares for you like me. I'm A good woman.
answer: Yes, I know. You are a good woman. Then again, you may be the Antichrist.

question: What the hell're we gonna do?
answer: Wait till the liquor wears off. Once they start getting headaches They'll lose interest.

question: Wyatt, they're threatening our lives.
answer: You'll never make that stick.

question: They're carrying guns in town.
answer: Virge, that's a misdemeanor. You Go down there to arrest 'em, Something goes wrong, maybe this Time somebody gets his head Broke, suddenly it's a mess and It won't end there, you'll have Cowboys comin' around lookin' for Trouble from here to Christmas. You gonna risk all that over a Misdemeanor?

question: No, damn it, it's wrong, they're Breakin' the law.
answer: All right, Virge, your call. But Give Doc the shotgun. They'll be Less apt to get nervy if they see Him on the street howitzer. Well... Come on, boys.

question: Mattie. What about this?
answer: I need it.

question: 'Least you admit it.
answer: Admit what, I'm an opium fiend? No, Wyatt, I just said I need it. I need something to keep me warm At night.

question: Look, Mattie, I know you're-
answer: You know nothing. What you don't Know would fill a book. Jesus, I Feel like it's when you're around I need it most. You're never Yourself, you never relax. Never. Everything's so stiff and dead. You always have to keep a rein on Everything, ever yourself. Oh, You smile sometimes, I've even Seen you laugh. But there's no Light in your smile for me, Wyatt, nothing to keep me warm. And I get cold, Wyatt. I get so cold. What's between you and that Jew woman?

question: All right, look. I can make it Right, I can make this up to you, Mattie. I can, I swear.
answer: Will you go to her and tell her Right in front of me she's Nothing to you? Right out loud so I can hear? Tell her she's Nothing, tell her she's nobody, Just dirt? Will you do that? Until you can do that we've got Nothing to talk about, Wyatt. Nothing. Now leave me alone.

question: Listen, I want to talk to you.
answer: Not now. I don't have time.

question: I saw that look pass between you And Wyatt at the fight. Listen to Me! You're mine! Understand? You're my woman and I'm your man.
answer: My man? You told Wyatt you'd Disarmed those men. Do you Actually believe after that I Could see you as my man? You're Just a dirty little fixer.

question: I want your blood and I want you Souls and I want them both right now.
answer: Don't want any more trouble, Ringo.

question: Well you got trouble and it Starts with you.
answer: I'm not gonna fight you, there's No money in it. Sober up. Come On, boys.

question: Here it come
answer: Johnny, don't, Jesus! Come on, Son... Never mind. He's drunk.

question: I want them spitting blood!
answer: Easy, Johnny. Now ain't the time. I tell you, boys, even I'm Worried what'll happen once Ringo Runs this outfit! God have mercy!

question: There's no God, there's no devil, I hate the God damn world! I want To die!
answer: Easy, son. You just need to get Your feet back under you, that's All. Come on, boy, let's kick South. Down to the old playground. See son, there is a God after all!

question: Get down, boy.
answer: Morgan, are you crazy? They're Out gunning for us! What the Hell're you doin'?

question: What's it look like? They want a Piece of me they can come and get It, I'm not crawlin' into my hole.
answer: Morg, use your head.

question: I am usin' it, Wyatt. Been Wonderin' how the hell we got in This tangle. You know they hit Clum's house, too? Shot up his wife. His wife. Who ever heard of That? Men sneakin' around in the Dark, back-shootin', scarin' Women? They're bugs, Wyatt. You Know all your smart talk about Live and let live? Ain't no live And let live with bugs.
answer: I know, I was wrong. But Morg, Look, we got to get out.

question: Listen to yourself, Wyatt. Lie Down and crawl or you might get Hurt? What kinda talk is that? That's Virgil lyin' over there, Wyatt. Our own brother. Ruined For life. No sir, I ain't going No place. You want to go, fine. I'm stayin' right here and have It out with those bastards. How much you wanna bet?
answer: I just got it fixed.

question: You're on.
answer: No, no! Get the doctor! Jesus Christ!

question: No, no! Get the doctor! Jesus Christ!
answer: Hold him.

question: Oh, no, get her out of her! Jesus!
answer: I said hold him, God damn it!

question: Somebody shut that dog up!
answer: You were right, Wyatt. They got Me good. Don't let 'em get you Too.

question: Will somebody get the damn dog out-
answer: Remember about the light you're Supposed to see when you're dyin'?

question: Easy Morg, don't think about that now.
answer: Isn't true. I can't see a damn thing.

question: Rest of us're 3 months out of Independece but we're from Carthage, Illinois originally.
answer: Carthage, really? I'm from Monmouth.

question: Another Illinois man! Practical Neighbors! Step down, Marshal. Have a feed. Ain't got law, ain't got nothin'. Only thing between us and the Animals. Always the way it goes, Though. Only way to down an Illinois man's from behind, the Dogs don't dare face 'em. Mr. Lincoln, Wild Bill, now your Brothers
answer: If the Lord is my friend.

question: Let not your heart be faint, let Your arm be steel-that's all you Need of the Lord.
answer: Know why you're here?

question: Drop his horse.
answer: I don't kill your brother! I Don't even know him. I was only Lookout. It was money, they give Me twelve dollars! It was money!

question: A human life. Twelve dollars.
answer: No!

question: Don't touch me!
answer: Sorry... You really look awful.

question: Not half as bad as I feel.
answer: Then why in hell're you doin' This? You ought to be in bed.

question: Wyatt Earp is my friend.
answer: Hell, I got lot's of friends.

question: There's no reasoning with him.
answer: Next waterhole's Black Draw. We Could be there by mid-morning.

question: They're wise by now. Which is Next, Iron Springs? Yeah, let's Try there, Iron Springs.
answer: There they are. No herd though.

question: We'll go around that way, come up on foot.
answer: Ambush! Get down!

question: No...
answer: Look at that! Yeah! Come and get Some, boy!

question: No...
answer: Let me, let me, yeah! Die, you Bastard...

question: No...
answer: Die! Son of a bitch! Die!

question: No!
answer: Come on!

question: No...
answer: Wyatt, my God! You're shot to pieces!

question: Sorry about your friend. And I'm sorry about...
answer: I forgave you the moment you said it.

question: You did. Well... thank you.
answer: I have to go.

question: No fire tonight, son. Too many Riders out. Who's that?
answer: It's Deputy Breakenridge.

question: Sister Boy! Thank God, we was afraid-
answer: You shouldn't've killed Mr. Fabian. You shouldn't've done That. It was wrong. I'm takin' You both in for it.

question: What? You gotta be kiddin'. Look, Just go home 'fore you get hurt.
answer: Don't want to kill you but I will If I have to. I'm warning you.

question: Don't want to kill you but I will If I have to. I'm warning you.
answer: No, I'm warning you, Sister Boy!

question: Don't try it!
answer: Sister Boy, just go to hell!

question: Might as well hear him out. Anyways, what choice we got? But no matter what happens, see It through to the end. If you don't I'll curse the day I ever laid eyes on you.
answer: Well hello, Sherm.

question: You wanted to talk?
answer: Yeah, kinda, wanted to see if you'd join back up with us.

question: That what you got me up here for?
answer: You're a Cowboy, you're a Brother. Come back, no hard Feelings.

question: Forget it, Ringo.
answer: Isn't there anything I can say That'll change your mind? You're Gonna stay with your new friends?

question: 'Least they don't scare women.
answer: You're the boss. One thing, though. How you gonna get back to 'em?

question: What makes a man like Ringo, Doc? What makes him do the things he does?
answer: A man like Ringo's got a great Empty hole right through the Middle of him and no matter what He does he can't ever fill it. He Can't kill enough or steal enough Or inflict enough pain to ever Fill it. And it drives him mad. Sick mad. Cold and dirty.

question: So what does he want?
answer: What does he want? He wants revenge.

question: Revenge? For what?
answer: Being born.

question: Remember how I said it all Happened so fast with Curly Bill I didn't have time to think about it? Well I've had plenty of time To think about this. I spent most Of my life since I was born not Knowing what I want out of life, Just chasin' my tail. But now, For the first time I know exactly What I want. And who. And that's The damnable misery of it. I can't beat him, can I?
answer: No, wait, I'll go with you... I'm sorry. I'm sorry, Wyatt. God, I'm so sorry.

question: That's all right, Doc. Don't worry.
answer: Never got to wear one of those.

question: Don't worry. They want him They'll have to go over us first.
answer: Only three. They left somebody Behind. Let's go take a look.

question: What're you doin' here?
answer: Who's in there?

question: It's Holliday. He's sick. Imagine He's dyin'.
answer: Drag him out here, let's have a look.

question: I looked the other way when you Did a lot of foul things but I Ain't lettin' you torment a dyin' Man. Not as long as he's under my Roof. I draw the line there.
answer: All right, Hooker. I'll be back In about an hour. We'll see how Brave you are then.

question: I'll be here.
answer: Soon as I'm through with Wyatt, Swarm down with the whole bunch And finish off Creek Johnson and Texas Jack.

question: Well, didn't think you had it in you. Shall we?
answer: Why Johnny Ringo, you look like Somebody just walked over your grave. Oh, I wasn't quite as sick as I Made out.

question: My fight's not with you, Holliday.
answer: I beg to differ. We started a Fight we never got to finish. Play for blood, remember?

question: I was kidding about that.
answer: I wasn't. And this time it's legal.

question: All right, lunger. Let's do it.
answer: Say when. Come on! Come on! Oh Johnny. You're no daisy, no Daisy at all.

question: Well hell, Wyatt. Wyatt, I want You to meet Father Feeney. Father Feeney's just been initiating me Into the mysteries of the great And ancient Church of Rome. You See, it appears my hypocrisy Knows no bounds.
answer: How you feelin', Doc?

question: Rather an obvious question under The circumstances, don't you Agree? A better one might be how Do you feel?
answer: Hurts. Hurts pretty bad.

question: I imagine it would, yes. So now We can add self-pity to your list Of frailties.
answer: All right, Doc...

question: You think I'm kidding. You're the Most fallible, wrong-headed, self- Deluding, just generally Benighted jackass I've ever Known. Yet, withal, even at your Worst, you're the only human Being in my entire life who ever Gave me hope.
answer: All I ever wanted was to live a Normal life.

question: When will you wake up? You Wouldn't know a normal life if it Bit you in the ass.
answer: That's great coming from you.

question: I played the cards I was dealt, Wyatt. Your problem is you're Always trying to play someone Else's. Allow me to tell you the Truth and thus set you free
answer: Then what do I do?

question: First you can grab that black- Haired woman and make her your own.
answer: All right. Then what?
